disqualified during primary compliance verification and four (4) during the secondary
evaluation on 19 March 2024.

sourcing a suitable service provider.

project_description: Rechargeable Voting Station Emergency Lights
reason_for_deviation:
In terms of Section 64 of the Electorate Act 17 of 1998, the Electoral Commission is
obliged to establish a network of voting stations throughout the country, which is is
used to conduct electoral activities.
With the current situation around unstable power supply and frequent power outages
due to load shedding or dameges to the power infrastructure it is necessary to take
precautionary steps to ensure that all voting stations are equipped with some form of
alternative or emergency lighting.
Apart from that, some voting stations currently do not have an existing supply of power
and it is, therefore, necessary to ensure acceptable operational conditions to enable
voting activities on 29 May 2024 as well as during 27 and 28 May 2024 when special
votes are cast across the country.
Irrespective of the best effort intended through the collaboration with Eskom, the latter
cannot commit to continuous power supply over the election period as load shedding
may be necessitated for the maintenance or repairs to electricity generation plants.
It is particularly noticeable that the country has been without load shedding for a
number of weeks at present. This is a significant achievement for Eskom over the past
number of years. However, the strain it places on power generation plants, especially
with the upcoming winter season, cannot be overlooked as that could lead to
significant power outages in future which may include the critical period at the end of
May 2024 during month which the elections are held.
Limited time is left in preparation for NPE 2024 which does not allow for an adequate
window period to advertise a tender for the prescribed minimum period of 21 days
since it is no longer possible to close, evaluate and award a new tender in time to allow
for delivery before voting commences on 29 May 2024. Hence we have requested to
advertise a tender on an urgent basis for a period shorter than the required 21 days.
